availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Cadwallader Lewis (Franklin County, Kentucky, baptist minister)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, baptist minister. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth H. Lewis. Father of William J. Lewism John A. Lewis, Waller H. Lewis, Mary P. Lewis, and Charles C. Lewis. Baptist minister in Franklin County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 4. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District No. 1, p. 2. Find A Grave, "Rev Cadwallader Lewis (1811-1882)," Memorial #73678702, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73678702/cadwallader-lewis (accessed January 23, 2018).
